title: Achieving High-Resolution Ptychographic Phase for Radiation-Sensitive Materials Using Multi-Frame/Multi-Pass Approach
content: Obtaining high-resolution images from radiation-sensitive materials in electron microscopy is challenging due to the inherent damage caused by the electron beam on the specimen. Traditional imaging techniques in scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM), such as annular dark-field (ADF) and annular bright-field (ABF) imaging, have been widely employed to obtain structural information in a broad range of materials even at atomic resolution. Nevertheless, the high flux or fluence of electron beam required for high-resolution imaging in these techniques limits the characterization of various beam sensitive materials, due to beam damage.
